meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be ill or injured in order to avoid work or duty.
meanings.sent1: The malingerer feigned sickness to skip school.
meanings.sent2: The soldier suspected his comrade of being a malingerer.
meanings.sent3: The malingerer's fake cough fooled no one.
meanings.sent4: She saw through his act like a detective uncovering a malingerer.
meanings.sent5: The lazy student became known as the class malingerer.

meanings.definition: To pretend to be ill or injured in order to avoid work or duty.
meanings.sent1: He would often malinger to avoid his chores.
meanings.sent2: She decided to malinger at home instead of going to work.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to malinger when it was time for a bath.
meanings.sent4: His excuses for not attending the meeting were clearly just a way to malinger.
meanings.sent5: The employee's constant malingerer was finally noticed by the boss.
